definitions.explanation_en: A feminine given name of Latin origin, derived from 'Patricius', meaning 'noble' or 'patrician'. It has been used historically in Europe and is common in English-speaking countries.
definitions.explanation_cn: 源自拉丁语的女性名，由 'Patricius' 演变而来，意为‘贵族的’或‘贵族出身的’。该名字在欧洲历史上广泛使用，如今在英语国家中仍较常见。
definitions.example_en: Patricia was appointed as the new CEO of the corporation.
definitions.example_cn: 帕特里夏被任命为这家公司的新首席执行官。
